This data attachment is just for a reference & not for an evaluation.

question_texts: GPT stands for

questions.question_text_1: Suppose we pre-train a model using a text-to-text framework. A user wants to fine-tune the pre-trained model on a regression task where the inputs are sentences but the labels are real-valued. The label values range from 0.1 to 2 with a step size of 0.1. Given these, choose the correct statements.
question_texts: Suppose we pre-train a model using a text-to-text framework. A user wants to fine-tune the pre-trained model on a regression task where the inputs are sentences but the labels are real-valued. The label values range from 0.1 to 2 with a step size of 0.1. Given these, choose the correct statements.

options.option_text: The objective function of the pre-trained model should be modified duringfine-tuning
The objective function of the pre-trained model need not be modified duringfine-tuning
Text-to-text framework cannot be used for any regression problem
We need to add a layer, on top of the output layer, that outputs a real value

questions.question_text_1: Suppose a GPT model is pre-trained using the Causal Language Modelling (CLM) objective and fine-tuned on a text summarization task. The context length T of the model was kept at 2048 during both pre-training and fine-tuning. Assume that the model uses Absolute Position Embedding (APE) with learnable parameters.  Based on the above data, answer the given subquestions.
question_texts: Suppose a GPT model is pre-trained using the Causal Language Modelling (CLM) objective and fine-tuned on a text summarization task. The context length T of the model was kept at 2048 during both pre-training and fine-tuning. Assume that the model uses Absolute Position Embedding (APE) with learnable parameters.  Based on the above data, answer the given subquestions.

questions.question_text_1: A user runs inference on the model N times with an input text that contains 712 tokens (including the special [start] token), then which of the following could be the possible length of summarized text
question_texts: A user runs inference on the model N times with an input text that contains 712 tokens (including the special [start] token), then which of the following could be the possible length of summarized text

questions.question_text_1: A user runs inference on the model N times with an input text that contains 712 tokens (including the special [start] token). However, the user observed that in each run the model generated the exact same summary. Based on this observation, select the decoding strategy that the model might be using
question_texts: A user runs inference on the model N times with an input text that contains 712 tokens (including the special [start] token). However, the user observed that in each run the model generated the exact same summary. Based on this observation, select the decoding strategy that the model might be using

options.option_text: Beam search with beam size K > 2
Greedy decoding by varying the temperature parameter T in the softmaxfunction for each run

questions.question_text_1: Suppose the number of encoder layers N = 3. What is the total number of learnable parameters, including the parameters of the input and position embedding layers, in the model? Enter the final answer in thousands. For example, if the answer is 12,238, then enter 12 as the answer.
